Configure PW EMS Role-Based Access

Use the following tasks to configure Role-based Access (RBAC) for users who connect to the PW EMS.

The PW EMS can be configured for users who access it in the following ways:

  • Renaming the default owner organization.
  • Creating new organizations.
  • Edit existing organizations.
  • Creating roles for new or existing organizations.
  • Creating user roles, user accounts, and manipulate user permissions by categories.
  • Manage user sessions, and so on.
  • Organizations
    An organization consists of users and vendor devices that can be a separate, individual company or entity or be one of many teams of users that belong to a single company or entity. Multiple organizations can be configured on the PW EMS system.
  • Edit the Default Organization
    The default organization is identified by the service provider who purchased the PW EMS software. Use this task to edit the default organization. Note that this default organization cannot deleted.
  • Create a New Organization
    A super administrator can create a new organization only. The Organizations tab can only be accessed by this user role.
  • Define User Roles for an Organization
    Role-based Access Control (RBAC) is a way to restrict system access to authorized users by determining user roles and the privileges they are allowed to perform on the PW EMS. The user roles described in the following sections are typical in service provider networks. You can specify the following user roles for your network or customize user roles to fit the characteristics of your network.
  • Create a New User Role for Your Organization
    An assigned user role is a collection of permitted operations that can be performed by this user. For example, a certain user is permitted to perform the operation of managing alarms. There is no limit for how many roles can be created for an organization.
  • Create a New User for Your Organization
    Use this task to create user accounts so they can be authenticated by the PW EMS.
